modules.description: Provides functions to create, access, and iterate over contiguous memory blocks, mimicking the Array module's interface. Works with polymorphic types wrapped in a contiguous memory structure, enabling efficient CPU cache utilization. Enables seamless integration with C FFI by offering a high-level alternative to the Field macro for memory access.

This module offers array manipulation through element-wise processing, subarray extraction, and in-place or fresh updates, along with low-level C array operations like conversion, slicing, and view creation without allocation. It works with C arrays ('a t) and Caml arrays, enabling efficient data handling by avoiding unnecessary copies. Specific use cases include performance-critical applications requiring direct memory management or interoperability with C libraries.
